brief_description: Optimization of ICS and phenotyping panels for the Mal067 study using cryopreserved PBMC samples from the SAC cohort
condition_studied: Vaccine immunogenicity and correlates of protection
description: Optimization of ICS and phenotyping panels for the Mal067 study using cryopreserved PBMC samples from the SAC cohort
endpoints: Primary endpoint is to enumerate antigen-specific cytokine-producing T-cells cells by intracellular cytokine staining and flow cytometry. Secondary and exploratory endpoints will include frequency of T cells expressing ctyotoxic markers and relative frequencies of cell subsets using ICS and aphenotyping staining panel.
hypothesis: Vaccination induces antigen-specific T cells that can be identified by ICS and flow cytometry upon antigen restimulation in vitro.
objectives: To determine antigen-specific T-cell responses, frequencies of cell subsets, and memory and activation immune status
official_title: Optimization Flow Cytometry panels for Mal067 study

program.contract_name: Immune Profile and Network Analysis of Malaria Infection and Vaccination
